1.text: Familiarize yourself with the Notations at a later step in the article.

2.text: Choose one face to start with.

4.text: Solve the four corners of the first layer, one by one.

5.text: Verify your first layer is correct.

6.text: Place the four edges of the middle layer.

13.text: This is the key to the notations used.

14.text: This article uses two different views for the Cube:

15.text: For the top view, each bar indicates the location of the important facelet.

16.text: When a facelet is grey, it means that its color is not important at the moment.

17.text: The arrows (blue or red) show what the algorithm will do.

18.text: For the top view, the light blue facelets indicate that an edge is incorrectly oriented.

19.text: For the move notations it is important to always look at the cube from the front side.
